newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finland Bank cuts tender rate to 3.00 pct.
newsitem.headline: Finland Bank cuts tender rate to 3.00 pct.

text.p: The Bank of Finland said on Wednesday it was lowering its tender rate, the key tool of monetary policy, to 3.00 percent from 3.10 percent with immediate effect SPFD.
"The board of the Bank of Finland has decided to cut the bank's tender rate from 3.10 percent to 3.00 percent. The decision takes effect immediately," the bank said.

The central bank's last move was to lower the tender rate on September 18, a cut of 15 basis points. The latest cut brings the key rate down by 300 basis points since October 1995, and brings it level with the German Bundesbank's repo rate.
